intro: Aconogonon sajanense, commonly known as the Sajan mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
